title.rendered: The Road Never Ends a film by Michael Movanis shows the lives of people in Middle East and Africa, was screened in Egypt

content.rendered:
The Road Never Ends is a film by Micheal Mouaness that shows the current life of people in countries such as Afghanistan, Lebanon, Algeria, Tunisia and Iraq.

The Road Never Ends is a film by Micheal Mouaness that shows the current life of people in countries such as Afghanistan, Lebanon, Algeria, Tunisia and Iraq.

The Road Never Ends is a film by Micheal Mouaness that shows the current life of people in countries such as Afghanistan, Lebanon, Algeria, Tunisia and Iraq.

The film was shown in 3 cinema halls simultaneously and attracted more than 500 spectators in Cairo on October 6, 2023 from 7:00 PM Cairo, Egypt, at 302 Lab

Interviewees face up to the past and tell their own story to the people.”

— Micheal Mouaness

CAIRO, EGYPT, October 9, 2023 /EINPresswire.com/ — The Road Never Ends is a film directed by Michael Movanis that shows the current lives of people in countries such as Afghanistan, Lebanon, Algeria, Tunisia and Iraq. The film was shown at the Cannes Film Festival in 2022 and received high praise.

The film focuses on the conflicts and challenges that people in these countries face on a daily basis. The director has done an excellent job in highlighting the human spirit and the resilience of the people in these countries.

The Road Never Ends is a must-read for anyone who wants to understand the current situation in the Middle East.

A new documentary screened at the 76th Cannes Film Festival sheds light on the unhealed wounds of people in the Middle East and North Africa region.

Through interviews, videos, and narration, the film reveals the pain and suffering experienced by many people in the region.

Critics praised the film for its poignant depiction of the human cost of conflict. It is an important and timely film that will help raise awareness of the ongoing problems in the Middle East and North Africa region.

The Road Never Ends was well received by filmmakers at the Cannes Film Festival, and is expected to continue to capture the attention of the filmmaking community.

The film tells the story of the director’s travels through the Middle East and his interactions with the people he meets there.

Nick Yvari is Director of the Italian Middle East Cooperation Department, and expressed his desire to introduce the film to a wider audience in Europe and the Middle East. “The Road Never Ends” has been praised for its honest portrayal of the Middle East and the people who live there.

The film tells the story of a group of friends who go on a road trip together. However, the journey takes a turn for the worse when they are caught in the middle of a war. The film is full of shocking scenes of violence and brutality that left the audience stunned.

The Road Never Ends was shown in 3 cinema halls in Cairo simultaneously and attracted more than 500 spectators in Cairo on October 6, 2023 from 7:00 PM Cairo, Egypt, at 302 Lab. Many VIP guests attended the screening…

Despite the difficulty of the subject, the film was very well received by the audience. They admired the way the film dealt with this difficult subject, and praised the director for his brave and honest style.

“The interviewees confront the past and tell their own story to the people.”

The documentary “The Road Never Ends” has been selected by many programmers for several film festivals such as the Red Sea International Film Festival. Meanwhile, Al Jazeera, National Geographic Channel, NGCA, and other major television stations have expressed their willingness to broadcast the documentary.

There were many interviews conducted after the screening. Many expressed their attitude towards the film. The Intellect Pictures film distributor said it is scheduled to be released in Morocco, UAE and Lebanon this year.

Alex Davidson
World Academy Awards

The Road Never Ends – A new documentary has been screened at 76th Cannes Film Festival. Interviewees face up to the past and tell their own story to the people.
